Straight Shot catches up to Lord Elder.  If she had learned anything from h=
er brother, it was how to put up a brave face, and do the things that you w=
ere afraid to do no matter if you knew the outcome or not. 

"Lord Elder, s=
ir, you're right too, I know what I gotta do, for my brother's sake.  I - r=
eally should try ta talk ta Legacy about all this, and get his side of the =
story.  Ohh boy, here it goes, Courage 101 in session."

She now walks off =
to find Legacy and by intuition, finds him readilly. Being as small as she =
was, what she was about to do, would take every ounce of bravory in her tin=
y spark. To be sure that she was at eye level with Legacy, so she didn't ne=
ed to crane her neck, she finds the highest point in the room, climbs on it=
, and looks to him as if she were about to talk to Tucson personally.

"Leg=
acy, if it's okay, could - we talk for a little while?"

Meanwhile, now tha=
t he was alone with Talon, Tucson had now loosened up quite a bit, with his=
 usually playful smile upon his face, as Talon envites him to take a walk. =


"How can I refuse your invitation?  Of course, I'd like that very much, T=
alon.  In fact, I've been meaning to ask you something for the longest time=
, and this seems like the perfect opportunity to ask you. But first..  Just=
 so we're not interrupted..."

He types in a code to close the doors, to al=
low them a little privacy.
Once hearing them shut, he smiles to Talon, and =
gently takes her hands.

"I've seen how happy it has made Rodimus to have N=
ightlight in his life and now, I see how happy it is to have you in mine."
=

He kneels on one knee.

" Talon, will you do me the honor of being my comp=
anion for all eternity?"
